result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shamya B Pollard

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:22 AM Defendant Shamya B Pollard in court. Attorney Christian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 10/20/2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with ANY Kohl's Department Stores.  No contact with the Co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant to have no contact with witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

3:10 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Shamya B Pollard in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Shamya B Pollard. Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, due to being a late add. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
